chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Durron L. Branch appeared by video.  Attorney Taylor N. Haefele in court on behalf of Attorney Allison Ritter for Durron L. Branch.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

**CLARIFICATION to 9-23-22 entry**

Defendant Durron Branch appeared by video in court.  Mr. Branch NOT in custody and was unaware of court date on September 23, 2022.  Court informed him of next court date, October 26, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Durron L. Branch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Durron L. Branch.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense unaware Mr. Branch is in custody and requests a status conference to allow time to speak with client.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF RECORD - Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Durron L. Branch appeared by video means. Defense is requesting another status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Investigator Matthew Kramer - City of S. Milwaukee P.D.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Durron L. Branch in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA AS TO COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/22 @ 2p
